result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Dietz

records.addlTxt: Arraignment set for 12/02/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Arraignment on December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Modify Bond

1:11 PM Defendant Christopher James Dietz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Return on Warrant in:  22CF320, 22CF301, 22CF160, 22CF142 & 21CF482.

BY THE COURT: 
All Warrants quashed on  22CF320, 22CF301, 22CF160, 22CF142 & 21CF482.

Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) states facts for anticipated charges of Theft - Intentionally Take, Felony Bail Jumping & Misdemeanor Bail Jumping.  
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Anne Renc currently represents the defendant on other cases.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record.
Court sets a $1,500 cash bond to cover all cases listed above with conditions as stated on the record.

To Cover all Cases:
22GF414, 22CF320, 22CF301, 22CF160, 22CF142 and 21CF482.
Not be on the premises of Festival Foods
Comply with all open bond conditions
BODY ONLY

Geographic Restriction is unacceptable as listed on the Warrant
Cancelled and will have new warrant issued sp

3:22 PM Defendant Christopher J Dietz not in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Christopher J Dietz.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
All files heard: 21CF482, 22CF142, 22CF160, 22CF301, 22CF320

Atty Dodge calls the cases and states the appearances.  Requests a body only warrant. 
Atty Renc has no information for the court. 
Atty Dodge makes additional statements regarding notice to the defendant. 
Court reviews each file for notice requirements. 
Court questions the parties regarding the notes from July 11. 
Atty Renc responds. 
Court notes notice was returned to the clerk's office.  

BY THE COURT: 
22CF320 was scheduled at 2:30 p.m. and parties advised he did not appear in Branch 2 for that case.  The parties are now in Branch 1. 
Court orders a warrant in each file and they will be body only. 

BY THE COURT:
Preliminary Hearing set for 09/06/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as addressed

Current: 270 SHANNON CT, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 12-03-2021)
Prior: 417 Washington Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Anne Renc
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher J Dietz in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Christopher J Dietz. 
All files heard: 21CF482, 21CM369, 22CF160, 22CF142

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

NOT GUILTY PLEA entered to 21CM369.

BY THE COURT:  Bonds continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc
Adjourned initial appearance on May 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:40 PM Defendant Christopher J Dietz in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF142, 22CF160, 21CF482 and 21CM369.

Defendant states that he was approved for a public defender today.
Matters are to be adjourned.
Defendant to appear with counsel and if not provide documentation that he is being appointed counsel.

BY THE COURT:
Adjourned one last time.
Bond continued in all 4 cases.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on May 9, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

1:26 PM Defendant Christopher J Dietz in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andy Mutchler for Atty Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 22CF160, 21CF482, 21CM369, and 22CF142. Will be called later.
1:30 PM Cases are recalled.
Court questions the Defendant if he has applied for public defender.
Defendant states he has lost his job and has reapplied.
Court adjourns these cases.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Initial Appearance set for April 18, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

1:07 PM Defendant Christopher Dietz appeared by video, Attorney Maxwell Bergner for Christopher Dietz appeared in court, Attorney Andrew Mutchler for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
All files heard: 22GF131, 21CF482, 21CM369

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC, Possession of Methamphetamine. 
Atty Bergner states he has not had time to review if the defendant is eligible. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court questions Atty Mutchler. 
Atty Mutchler requests the warrants in 21CF482 and 21CM369 be quashed and warrant set. 

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond.  Bond has not been set in the warrant cases either.  

BY THE COURT: 
Warrants are quashed and original bonds reinstated on 21CF482 & 21CM369. 

All files set for 4/18 @ 1:30 for initial appearance.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
